locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the universal experience of feeling 'not good enough' through cultural references (movies, literature, psychology) and contrasts this with Paul's theology of justification and the Spirit.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. Correctly identifies the 'Law of Sin and Death' as an inexorable process and links Romans 5 (Adam/Christ) to Romans 8.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher moves from describing the human condition (Assertive) to a climactic announcement of the Gospel (Commissive/Declarative).
voorbeelden: There is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.
In Jesus Christ we are set free!

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Relief from the 'terror of being undone', assurance of salvation, and motivation for transformation through the Spirit.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: High. Explicitly discusses the 'Law of the Spirit' as a gift of power for transformation.

voorbeelden: The fear of being pronounced guilty haunts us all our lives.
St. Paul calls it the law of sin and death.
God has not pronounced the verdict... solely to let us go back.
Don’t wait for the Last Judgment (quoted)
Only you can decide which of these three groups you belong in.
It gives me the greatest imaginable joy to preach today.
I was profoundly moved and humbled.
He himself became 'The Judge Judged in Our Place'.
He will come to be our Judge.
He has brought us into the new sphere.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly Christocentric; God's binding action in Christ is the focal point.

voorbeelden: There is now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus.
In Jesus Christ we are set free!
declaratieven.autoriteit: High; the preacher speaks as a mandatory of the Gospel text.

indicatoren: Extensive use of cultural illustrations (Camus, Conrad, New Yorker cartoons) to describe the human condition.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Creates a strong sense of 'recognition' and 'resonance' before the performative word is spoken.

missende_elementen: Could use more direct 2nd person 'I absolve you' style declaratives.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Very clear and direct address to the 'panic' of the hearer.
voorbeelden: To every single one of us this morning... the great word comes... 'Not guilty!'

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Directly addressing the 'panic' and the 'ears to hear'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the human condition and biblical history.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'Now' of the Gospel (There is NOW no condemnation).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the Assertive (The Law of Sin) to the Declarative (No Condemnation) to the Commissive (Spirit's Power).
voorbeelden: The verdict has been dramatically reversed... set free to live... according to the Spirit.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Excellent transition from indicative to the power of the new life.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because of what Jesus has accomplished... we are set free to live.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as an event because it doesn't just talk about grace; it delivers the verdict of 'Not Guilty' to a specifically diagnosed human condition.

sterke_punten.effect: Creates a sacramental moment of release.

zwakke_punten.probleem: Risk of delaying the 'event' too long.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon successfully transitions from 'talking about' guilt to 'pronouncing' acquittal.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts as a mandatory, reversing the 'thundering verdict' of the world with the Word of God.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, God is the one who reverses the verdict.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher claims the 'greatest joy' to preach this specific text as the answer.
tekstueel_bewijs: The verdict has been dramatically reversed by the only one who has the power to reverse it.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the 'Law of the Spirit of Life'.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the Spirit is the 'gift of power' that enables the change.
tekstueel_bewijs: Shouldn’t I expect Jesus to be working in me?

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the delivery of the acquittal.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Yes, the use of 'Now' and 'Not Guilty' creates an epiphanic present.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is well-balanced, though heavily weighted toward the assertive in the first half to build tension.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The verdict has been dramatically reversed.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, in this room, God reverses the verdict for you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a description of a past/abstract event to a present-tense speech act.

voorbeeldzinnen: I announce to you: you are good enough in Christ.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The 'three kinds of people' section is slightly analytical (3rd person).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address each group directly in the 2nd person.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, who are in a panic: hear this word.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in moving from the 'constative' reality of human guilt to the 'performative' reality of divine grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal', SAT shows the preacher actually changing the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: It goes beyond persuasion; it aims at a 'felicitous' declaration that actually 'sets free'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the power of this sermon lies in the 'Declarative' force of the 'Not Guilty' verdict, not just the cleverness of the movie illustrations.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Law/Gospel' dialectic that maps perfectly onto the 'Constative/Performative' distinction.
